God, what are this person's credentials? People who didn't create a disturbance at the opera were operating from the morally pure position that """"The show must go on""""? A. Not proven and highly unlikely - elementary bystander theory applies. B. Even if they were operating from this principle no one but the author would argue that theirs was the """"morally pure"""" position. C. In any case even if A and B weren't issues, there's no analogy to be drawn between the opera scenario and zero tolerance for animal exploitation. The more applicable analogy is - folks who argue for larger cages over abolition are similar to folks who argue for restriction of pedophilic activities to Thursdays, Saturdays and alternate Sunday afternoons.
